data.title: So Charming and Absolutely Wonderful
data.text: My husband visited in September and I loved this wonderful, quiet Inn.  It is clean, quiet and very comfortable.  It was so charming, I really hated to leave.  The home and gardens and beautiful and very well maintained and while we never saw the Inn keepers, there was no need. They are extremely organized and ready for your visit. The information they provided about the area was extremely helpful.  We visited San Francisco and Santa Cruz during our time there and while the drive to San Francisco was a little bit of drive, it was extremely worth it to stay here.

data.title: So charming!
data.text: I stayed for a week in August and had the most lovely time in this charming house! Very quiet, clean, and comfortable. I felt like home instantly. The bed was very comfortable, and I really enjoyed the gardens and the little fountains outside. I can't wait to come back!

data.title: I love this bed and breakfast!`
data.text: The bed and breakfast is very hands off type of feel. From the moment you check in you feel like its your home. There is a large movie selection, a large dish of free chocolates, and plenty of rooms to relax in. The best part is its in walking distance of great shopping and dining. Don't expect a chatty inn keeper though. The owners prefer the guests to be on their own. Best BNB in Santa Cruz for sure!

data.title: The "InnHopper" says this is a must stay B & B.
data.text: This is an interesting and beautiful home with awesome gardens. The room was very well appointed with a comfortable bed and seating. Would love to stay again some time. The continental breakfast was very satisfying.

data.title: A real gem
data.text: Thanks to American  travelling companions we found ourselves at this delightful B &B.It was a true home from home with all the amenities you would expect to find there.It was truly peaceful and beautifully decorated throughout with two resident's lounges and a fully fitted kitchen.,so no need to eat out if you you didn't want to.On saying that Santa Cruz is an interesting place with lots of good shops and eating places all of which are just a short walk from the B &B.Thanks to the comprehensive guide left by the owners we were able to choose an excellent place called Laili to eat.It was an interesting mix of Mediterranean and middle eastern food and was obviously very popular with visitors and locals alike always a good sign.Our one concern was having to leave credit card details in a specified place in the B &B.Personally speaking I would have liked some human contact when settling our account and an actual bill print out so we could check this against credit card statement later but I do understand the owners wishing to respect their guest's privacy.This is a minor point and didn't detract in any way from our state at this beautiful place.The miniature muffins at breakfast were delightful and our only complaint there was there weren't enough!

data.title: A quiet refuge for the adult traveler
data.text: So far we have stayed in all of the rooms and love them all. This time we were in the Retreat Room at the back of the house and just loved the quietness and the total lack of activity around us. After checking into the room we took a quiet stroll around downtown (less than a five minute walk from there) and did some light shopping.  This is my go to place when traveling to Santa Cruz.

data.title: Sweet spot
data.text: Our second stay, and we'll be back again.  Great location, easy walk downtown, walk to the Santa Cruz mission less than 2 blocks.  List of local recommendations for restaurants and shopping was spot on.  Lovely well thought out secluded spaces in garden.

data.title: Great B&B
data.text: Our 2nd time here had a great stay,excellent breakfast choices,quiet rooms ,great location easy to walk into town. Would definately recommend ,good DVDs selection to watch in your room if desired. We will come back again

data.title: A wonderful urban retreat!
data.text: So, we've stayed here twice now and will continue to book this place each time we come to Santa Cruz.  It's a well-kept property.  The rooms are warm, cozy, charming, well-appointed.  There are even wonderful little touches like Philips, non-flame LED tea lights available to give your room that special touch.  The innkeepers are great designers, not only of the facility but of the way they foster human interaction with it.  And this goes for the Adobe's location in the Santa Cruz core.  Easy access to the city center makes this particularly attractive.  We walk to great restaurants...and then head up Hwy 1 to Wilder Ranch Park for nature walks.  For some, it might feel odd never to meet the innkeepers (they intentionally keep out of sight), but for us this makes it feel like we don't have to negotiate the occasionally awkwardness of busy innkeepers.  And incidentally, though the inn is often full, we've hardly ever bumped into anyone else.  It's a magical place.  And one time we had a problem with a squeaky bed and left a comment.  The innkeeper responded immediately and made things right.  You'll not regret staying here, unless you need a busy, noisy place, with an innkeeper who is always present.

data.title: Outstanding!
data.text: Adobe on Green St BnB--wonderful! Rather than write a review that is a spoiler, I'll leave this as a review you will just have to trust me. Like surfing, its better to explore and find a secret spot that people don't explicitly detail.

data.title: I love the Adobe on Green!
data.text: Great location, walking distance to everything in downtown Santa Cruz, close to the beach, very, very sweet garden, clean, welcoming, I love the decor and at a great price! I try to stay here whenever I'm in the area for work or play.

data.title: The most charming bed and breakfast
data.text:
This was a wonderful surprise for us after a drive from San Francisco International Airport. A beautiful and tastefully furnished adobe styled house. 
The room was large and well appointed. 
The owners give you details and suggestions on the house and the town and then stay out of your way. I found the suggestions very useful and handy. 
We thoroughly enjoyed our short stay here and wished we had the time to stay longer. 
I would highly recommend this to anybody

data.title: The perfect place for introverts
data.text: Some other reviewers complained that there was no chatter with the hosts. I can only say that this place was a wonderful respite from talking all day at a conference and I could not have been happier here. If I come back I won't even consider staying elsewhere. I hope that, in time, the hosts will not feel the need to defend their beautiful, considered and elegant approach to their business.

data.title: Quiet, beautiful, and comfortable
data.text: Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay for a three day conference at UCSC.  A quiet hideaway with free parking and a five minute walk to the bus to campus.  Room was clean, spacious, and inviting.

data.title: Tranquil Travels
data.text:
This is a little oasis away from the bustle of the city, we had a lovely stay here and felt revitalised to continue our travels.
The Adobe has a delightful garden surrounding it with plenty of places to sit with a glass of wine and relax, indoors is more of the same- beautifully furnished with lots of little details that add to the calming environment.
In practical terms the bedroom and en-suite have all the home comforts you need, it's peaceful at night, the wifi is free and quick (also an apple mac in the library available to guests) and the kitchen is open to use- you can help yourself to a cold drink from the fridge.
The welcome pack is very detailed and we found it extemely useful for restaurant recommendations, it's only a short 5 minute walk to the centre of Santa Cruz where all the shops & bars are located, everywhere is witin easy reach.
We enjoyed breakfast, a thoughtful buffet of fruit, cereal, homebaked scones, yoghurt, egg, plenty to choose from and all delicious.
This was a real highlight of our trip around California and we wholeheartedly recommend staying here.

data.title: Serenity with five star hotel comfort.
data.text: I love coming to Adobe on Green Street. Every detail from the lighting to the best bed ever has been carefully thought out. I really never want to leave. This last visit I drank my delicious coffee on the patio outside my room and watched 10+ hummingbirds play and drink in the water fountain.

data.title: Downtown Oasis
data.text:
This is a special B&B where guests are given a lot of privacy and independence.  It is so sweet and thoughtful I woke up each morning wishing I could just live here.  It is set on a hill just above downtown.  Far enough from the hustle to be peaceful and quiet, but close enough to walk to dinner in ten minutes. The views out every window are of green palms, succulents and fountains.  There is a great DVD library with recommended films that I have never seen before. 

This place is equipped with ample electrical plugs in the room, great beds, and solar electricity.  It is also wonderful for what the owners here don't do.  They don't chat you up, insist on conversation at breakfast, or waste your time.  This is an oasis and the owners leave it wonderfully quiet and peaceful for their guests.  Wish there were more places like this. Wish also I could give six stars.

data.title: Wonder Full place
data.text:
We had a wonderful stay at the Adobe, it is certainly a beautifully furnished, decorated and well designed house, a tremendous amount of thought and attention has been paid by the owners to all aspects and we found the Adobe to be a peaceful relaxing space.
The local area information provided by the owners was detailed and absolutely spot on, we loved Santa Cruz
We travelled from San Francisco down to Los Angeles staying at a variety of Hotels, Lodges and of course the Adobe, this was certainly the best we experienced, we cannot recommend it highly enough and would love to stay again.

data.title: Charming and a Little Odd
data.text:
The location is wonderful: on a hill just a few steps from the Santa Cruz Mission and only a few blocks from downtown. You can easily walk to the boardwalk and the wharf and avoid all the parking and driving hassles. The grounds absolutely enchanting, marvelous flowers and plants, bird feeders and baths. And the house itself isarchitecturally interesting as well as comfortable. Unusually for an adobe house, the windows are wide, allowing for wonderful light and ocean breezes. And this is perhaps the most environmentally responsible and sustainable property I have ever stayed in.

One caveat, for those who like to interact with hosts at a B&B, this is not your place: these hosts are very much in the background.  There is an owner's presence; you just don't see or talk to them.  Also, since breakfast is self-serve, don't expect the kind of elaborate production featured in many other B&Bs.

data.title: Like home
data.text: Best B&B ever. Immaculate property. We had the room upstairs, which was wonderful, you have the whole floor to yourself. We did not see the owners, they set up the place and arrival/departure arrangements such that you can navigate it all on your own. Makes it feel like you are at home. We especially appreciated all the green features, like the solar on the roof, the EV charger and the ecologic toiletries. Great breakfast buffet too, just the way we like it: plenty, yum and healthy.
